gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - Hg Aerosol from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Concentration of atmospheric aerosol total mercury (Hg) from the 2010 and 2011 U.S. GEOTRACES crusies. Dataset Description: <p>This dataset includes concentrations of atmospheric aerosol total mercury across the North Atlantic Zonal Transect.</p> Acquisition Description: <p>In general, the cruise path was contained from 15 to 40 N and 19 to 70 W. Aerosols were collected by Tisch high-volume aerosol sampler mounted on the 03 deck of the R/V Knorr, forward of the main stack. Sampling was sector-controlled to collect air only arriving at the ship from over the bow, to avoid sampling stack gases and debris associated with science activities on the back deck.</p><p>Samples were frozen and transported to Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (Woods Hole, MA) where they were analyzed within 3 months of collection. The filter swaths that were provided were digested in acid-cleaned polypropylene containers with 5 mL of 2N HNO3, heated to 60 degrees C and sonicated. Following digestion, 1 mL of BrCl was added directly to the digestate (Lamborg et al., 1995, Morton et al., in press).</p><p><b>Total mercury analysis:</b><br />- Fitzgerald &amp; Gill, 1979, Bloom &amp; Fitzgerald, 1988, Bloom, 1989.<br />- Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector<br />- Detection limit: 50 fmoles<br />- Procedural duplicates: 3 &plusmn; 2 percent r.s.d. (n=24)<br />- Results are presented in filter- and reagent-blank corrected form.</p><p><b>References:</b><br /><b>Bloom</b>, N. 1989. Determination of picogram levels of methylmercury by aqueous phase ethylation, followed by cryogenic gas-chromatography with cold vapor atomic fluorescence detection. Can. J. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 46, 1131&ndash;1140. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1139/f89-147">10.1139/f89-147</a><br /><b>Bloom</b>, N.S., Fitzgerald, W.F. 1988. Determination of volatile mercury species at the picogram level by low-temperature gas chromatography with cold-vapor atomic fluorescence detection. Anal. Chim Acta 208, 151&ndash;161. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0003-2670(00)80743-6">10.1016/S0003-2670(00)80743-6</a><br /><b>Fitzgerald</b>, W.F., Gill, G.A. 1979. Subnanogram determination of mercury by two-stage gold amalgamation applied to atmospheric analysis. Anal. Chem. 51, 1714&ndash;1720. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ac50047a030">10.1021/ac50047a030</a><br /><b>Lamborg</b>, C.H., Fitzgerald, W.F., Vandal, G.M. and Rolfhus, K.R., 1995. Atmospheric Mercury in Northern Wisconsin - Sources and Species. Water Air and Soil Pollution, 80(1-4): 189-198. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/BF01189667">10.1007/BF01189667</a><br /><b>Morton</b>, P.L. et al., in press. INTERCAL: Results from the 2008 GEOTRACES aerosol intercalibration study. Limnology and Oceanography-Methods.</p>

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32025.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32026.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRACES #', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32027.rdf Name: year_start Units: YYYY Description: 4-digit year (GMT) at start of sampling event. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32028.rdf Name: month_start Units: mm (01 to 12) Description: 2-digit month of year (GMT) at start of sampling event. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32029.rdf Name: day_start Units: dd (01 to 31) Description: 2-digit day of month (GMT) at start of sampling event. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32030.rdf Name: time_start Units: HHMM Description: Time (GMT) in HHMM format at start of sampling event; 24-hour clock. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32031.rdf Name: lat_start Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude at start of sampling event. North = Positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32032.rdf Name: lon_start Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude at start of sampling event. West = Negative. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32033.rdf Name: year_end Units: YYYY Description: 4-digit year (GMT) at end of sampling event. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32034.rdf Name: month_end Units: mm (01 to 12) Description: 2-digit month of year (GMT) at end of sampling event. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32035.rdf Name: day_end Units: dd (01 to 31) Description: 2-digit day of month (GMT) at end of sampling event. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32036.rdf Name: time_end Units: HHMM Description: Time (GMT) in HHMM format at end of sampling event; 24-hour clock. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32037.rdf Name: lat_end Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude at end of sampling event. North = Positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32038.rdf Name: lon_end Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude at end of sampling event. West = Negative. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32039.rdf Name: run_time Units: hours Description: Total run time in hours. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32040.rdf Name: flow_rate Units: m^3/min Description: Flow rate in cubic meters per minute. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32041.rdf Name: vol_tot Units: m^3 Description: Total volume sampled in cubic meters. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32042.rdf Name: Hg_tot Units: pg/m^3 Description: Total mercury. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32043.rdf Name: Hg_tot_rsd Units: % Description: Relative standard deviation (RSD) of Hg_tot. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32044.rdf Name: Hg_tot_sd Units: pg/m^3 Description: Standard deviation of Hg_tot. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32045.rdf Name: Hg_tot_q_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for Hg_tot. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32071.rdf Name: filter Units: text Description: Filter type. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33150.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33151.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33230.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC_start Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the start of sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33231.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC_end Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the end of sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRACES #', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: 4-digit year (GMT) at start of sampling event.; General Description: starting year of sampling/operation, GMT

PI-supplied Description: 2-digit month of year (GMT) at start of sampling event.; General Description: month at start of measurement period, use in conjunction with month_end and only when the duration of sampling is a critical element to the measurement.

PI-supplied Description: 2-digit day of month (GMT) at start of sampling event.; General Description: day at beginning of measurement period, use in conjuction with day_end and only when the duration of sampling is a critical element to the measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Time (GMT) in HHMM format at start of sampling event; 24-hour clock.; General Description: starting time of observation, GMT time, 24 hour clock

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: latitude at start time of measurement

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Latitude at start of sampling event. North = Positive.; General Description: latitude at start time of measurement; in decimal degrees (negative denotes South) NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: longitude at start time of measurement

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: longitude at start time of measurement

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Longitude at start of sampling event. West = Negative.; General Description: longitude at starting time of measurement (west is negative), in decimal degrees NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: 4-digit year (GMT) at end of sampling event.; General Description: ending year of sampling/operation, GMT, used in conjunction with year_start
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit month of year (GMT) at end of sampling event.; General Description: month at end of measurement period, see month_start.
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit day of month (GMT) at end of sampling event.; General Description: day at ending of measurement period, see day_begin.
PI-supplied Description: Time (GMT) in HHMM format at end of sampling event; 24-hour clock.; General Description: ending time of observation, GMT time , 24 hour clock

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: latitude at end time of measurement

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: latitude at end time of measurement

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Latitude at end of sampling event. North = Positive.; General Description: latitude at end time of measurement; in decimal degrees (negative denotes South) NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: longitude at end time of measurement

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: longitude at end time of measurement

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Longitude at end of sampling event. West = Negative.; General Description: longitude at end time of measurement; in decimal degrees (negative denotes West) NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Total run time in hours.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Flow rate in cubic meters per minute.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined
PI-supplied Description: Total volume sampled in cubic meters.; General Description: volume of the sample, i.e., sample size

PI-supplied Description: Total mercury.; General Description: Concentration of metal elements in any phase of the atmosphere. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Concentration of metal elements in any phase of the atmosphere

PI-supplied Description: Relative standard deviation (RSD) of Hg_tot.; General Description: The relative standard deviation (RSD or %RSD) is the absolute value of the coefficient of variation. It is often expressed as a percentage. A similar term that is sometimes used is the relative variance which is the square of the coefficient of variation. Also, the relative standard error is a measure of a statistical estimate's reliability obtained by dividing the standard error by the estimate; then multiplied by 100 to be expressed as a percentage.The relative standard deviation is widely used in analytical chemistry to express the precision and repeatability of an assay. It is also commonly used in fields such as engineering or physics when doing quality assurance studies and ANOVA gauge R&R. 100 [(standard deviation of array X)/ (average of array X)] = relative standard deviation expressed as a percentage Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_standard_deviation
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of Hg_tot.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for Hg_tot.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation
PI-supplied Description: Filter type.; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the start of sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the end of sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>In general, the cruise path was contained from 15 to 40 N and 19 to 70 W. Aerosols were collected by Tisch high-volume aerosol sampler mounted on the 03 deck of the R/V Knorr, forward of the main stack. Sampling was sector-controlled to collect air only arriving at the ship from over the bow, to avoid sampling stack gases and debris associated with science activities on the back deck.</p><p>Samples were frozen and transported to Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (Woods Hole, MA) where they were analyzed within 3 months of collection. The filter swaths that were provided were digested in acid-cleaned polypropylene containers with 5 mL of 2N HNO3, heated to 60 degrees C and sonicated. Following digestion, 1 mL of BrCl was added directly to the digestate (Lamborg et al., 1995, Morton et al., in press).</p><p><b>Total mercury analysis:</b><br />- Fitzgerald &amp; Gill, 1979, Bloom &amp; Fitzgerald, 1988, Bloom, 1989.<br />- Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector<br />- Detection limit: 50 fmoles<br />- Procedural duplicates: 3 &plusmn; 2 percent r.s.d. (n=24)<br />- Results are presented in filter- and reagent-blank corrected form.</p><p><b>References:</b><br /><b>Bloom</b>, N. 1989. Determination of picogram levels of methylmercury by aqueous phase ethylation, followed by cryogenic gas-chromatography with cold vapor atomic fluorescence detection. Can. J. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 46, 1131&ndash;1140. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1139/f89-147">10.1139/f89-147</a><br /><b>Bloom</b>, N.S., Fitzgerald, W.F. 1988. Determination of volatile mercury species at the picogram level by low-temperature gas chromatography with cold-vapor atomic fluorescence detection. Anal. Chim Acta 208, 151&ndash;161. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0003-2670(00)80743-6">10.1016/S0003-2670(00)80743-6</a><br /><b>Fitzgerald</b>, W.F., Gill, G.A. 1979. Subnanogram determination of mercury by two-stage gold amalgamation applied to atmospheric analysis. Anal. Chem. 51, 1714&ndash;1720. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ac50047a030">10.1021/ac50047a030</a><br /><b>Lamborg</b>, C.H., Fitzgerald, W.F., Vandal, G.M. and Rolfhus, K.R., 1995. Atmospheric Mercury in Northern Wisconsin - Sources and Species. Water Air and Soil Pollution, 80(1-4): 189-198. DOI: <a target="_blank" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/BF01189667">10.1007/BF01189667</a><br /><b>Morton</b>, P.L. et al., in press. INTERCAL: Results from the 2008 GEOTRACES aerosol intercalibration study. Limnology and Oceanography-Methods.</p>

<p>Quality Flags:<br />2 = ok<br />3 = questionable <br />4 = bad analysis<br />5 = sample lost<br />6 = mean of replicates<br />9 = sample was not collected for Hg analysis</p><p>'&lt; DL' indicates that a sample was below the method detection limit Sampling metadata (location, flow rates, sampling duration, etc) are courtesy of Rachel Shelley and Bill Landing (FSU).</p><p>BCO-DMO made the following edits:<br />- Replaced 'not available' with 'nd' to indicate 'no data'.<br />- Separated each original date-time field to month, day, year, and time fields.<br />- Added the cruise_id column.</p><p><b>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</b><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called &quot;join&quot;) was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters. <br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Aerosol Sampler PI Supplied Instrument Description:Aerosols were collected by Tisch high-volume aerosol samplers. Instrument Name: Aerosol Sampler Instrument Short Name:Aerosol_Sampler Instrument Description: A device that collects a sample of aerosol (dry particles or liquid droplets) from the atmosphere. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/13/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Cold Vapor Atomic Fluorescence Spectrophotometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:A Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector was used. See the manufacturer's product fact sheet (PDF; opens in new window/tab). Instrument Name: Cold Vapor Atomic Fluorescence Spectrophotometer Instrument Short Name:CVAFS Instrument Description: A Cold Vapor Atomic Fluorescent Spectrophotometer (CVAFS) is an instrument used for quantitative determination of volatile heavy metals, such as mercury. CVAFS make use of the characteristic of mercury that allows vapor measurement at room temperature. Mercury atoms in an inert carrier gas are excited by a collimated UV light source at a particular wavelength. As the atoms return to their non-excited state they re-radiate their absorbed energy at the same wavelength. The fluorescence may be detected using a photomultiplier tube or UV photodiode.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
